alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Susquehanna and central Bradford Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 528 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burlington, or near Towanda, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rush, Towanda, Canton, West Franklin, Wysox, Sheshequin, Ulster, Orwell, North Towanda and Herrick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
